body: minSize is an estimation of the size before minimizing. For technical reasons we don't have the final size when we need to decide which module to put in which chunk

@sokra thanks a lot for replying. Yeah I am aware of the fact that minSize is before minimizing, which is the reason I have used **minimize: false** option to get better idea of chunks size. I still don't get your second statement completely though.  So we don't have the final size to decide thus not have size to compare with minSize. Does that mean webpack will always create initial vendor chunks.  

According to my understanding on that statement of yours webpack will check if we have disabled vendor cache group or not. If yes, it will not create any initial vendor chunk. If not, vendor chunk will be generated no matter what minSize restriction. In case of large minSize let say 9Mb webpack is not generating any initial vendor chunks so it must have some kind of max limit range in code too where if exceeded webpack will evidently not create any vendor chunk.
Maybe I have to note that 517kiB > 520000 bytes
My bad. So yeah 517kib is approx 529408 bytes. But still even if I change minSize to 600000 bytes splitchunkplugin still generating vendor~a chunk !
@alexander-akait can you help me out in here please. I will be glad of it !

I don't know what's causing that, could you provide a repro so we can test this locally too.

Maybe also check if this is already fixed in webpack 5.
Thanks. I found the problem. It's a bug in webpack.
Kudos to you @sokra . So should I test it now reinstalling same version of webpack ?
I'll also backport this to webpack 4
@sokra  is it merged to main branch now ? I have reinstalled my webpack dependencies but still getting the issue. If not, kindly can I know approx when will it be pushed to production
